science.headline: Your Voice Gives Away Valuable Personal Information
science.teaser: The privacy risks of always-listening voice control systems—and how to protect against them The post Your Voice Gives Away Valuable Personal Information appeared first on Nautilus .
science.tldr: Alerts users to potential security breaches through voice assistants

science.headline: The 3 best ways to tackle anxiety, according to a leading expert
science.teaser: It is impossible to get rid of anxiety because it exists to help us, says cognitive psychotherapist Owen O'Kane. Instead, he suggests three ways to reframe your relationship with anxiety in order to take back control
science.tldr: Recognizes that anxiety has a purpose beyond mere elimination

science.headline: Scientists investigate ‘dark oxygen’ in deep-sea mining zone
science.teaser: Startling findings in 2024 suggested that metallic nodules on the sea floor produce oxygen and might support life. Now researchers are planning an expedition to learn more and refute criticism from mining companies
science.tldr: Investigates the potential for oxygen-producing nodules to support life underground

science.headline: Mars once had a vast sea the size of the Arctic Ocean
science.teaser: Spacecraft orbiting the Red Planet have helped researchers map out an ancient coastline that surrounded a large ocean billions of years ago
science.tldr: Unveils new information about Mars' ocean that challenges current understanding

science.headline: Sunscreens made from ground-up wood reach an SPF of over 180
science.teaser: Concerns around common sunscreen chemicals have prompted the search for natural alternatives, with lignin from wood being one of the most promising candidates
science.tldr: Identifies promising natural sunscreen alternative to address chemical concerns

science.headline: Chernobyl cooling systems have lost power but meltdown risk is low
science.teaser: An electrical outage at Chernobyl nuclear power plant risks dangerous fuel overheating, but experts say that the chances are extremely slim due to the age of the reactors, which were shut down over two decades ago
science.tldr: Activates alarm over potential fuel overheating due to electrical outage

science.headline: Satellites could use magnetic fields to avoid collisions
science.teaser: Two or more satellites could communicate and manoeuvre around one another using magnetic fields, although getting the technique to work at scale in space might be tricky
science.tldr: Avoids catastrophic collisions for satellites by using magnetic fields

science.headline: Barnacle gloop could improve inflammatory bowel disease treatments
science.teaser: A "living glue" used by barnacles to attach to underwater surfaces could also seal gut wounds caused by inflammatory bowel disease
science.tldr: Helps develop new treatments for gut wounds caused by inflammatory bowel disease

society.headline: How Europe Can Respond to Trump’s Greenland Imperalism
society.teaser: The President’s obsession with acquiring the Danish territory has put the transatlantic alliance at risk.
society.tldr: Challenges the transatlantic alliance's stability with Trump's Greenland ambitions

society.headline: For This Palisades Toymaker, Fire Safety Is No Game
society.teaser: Jeremy Padawer, whose company owns Squishmallows, is one of thousands devastated by last year’s fire. At a rally for the anniversary, he’s more passionate than ever about reform.
society.tldr: Overturns years of manufacturing safety protocols after devastating factory fire

society.headline: Contesting American Citizenship… in 1784
society.teaser: The Longchamps Affair shows how early Americans struggled to define citizenship amid conflicting laws and revolutionary values. The post Contesting American Citizenship… in 1784 appeared first on JSTOR Daily .
society.tldr: Rejects traditional notions of citizenship by examining early American complexities

society.headline: Souvenir Hunting on the Battlefield of Waterloo
society.teaser: At Waterloo, a site of immense bloodshed, tourists quickly turned the aftermath of war into collectibles. The post Souvenir Hunting on the Battlefield of Waterloo appeared first on JSTOR Daily .
society.tldr: Rejects the notion that war memorials are only about remembrance

society.headline: Ask Xander & Mariluisa
society.teaser: Relationship advice from the internet: on Friday Afternoon Sex Clubs, adoption, and synchronized waterskiing.
society.tldr: Raises questions about human behavior and relationships in unusual settings

society.headline: Trump has become the West’s Mad King
society.teaser: The president sees no difference between his whims and the power of the American empire
society.tldr: Challenges the notion of presidential power and accountability in democracy

society.headline: Brooklyn has been swallowed by brand Beckham
society.teaser: Victoria and David Beckham exist both as a flesh-and-blood family and as a narrative spectacle
society.tldr: Challenges traditional notions of celebrity and family as a cultural phenomenon

society.headline: Welfare Fraud Is a Problem—For Democrats
society.teaser: Safeguarding the social safety net is essential for keeping it.
society.tldr: Prevents devastating consequences for vulnerable populations by identifying and addressing fraud

society.headline: Americans’ confidence in scientists
society.teaser: Key Takeaways: Americans’ confidence in scientists since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic Pew Research Center has tracked trends in public trust in scientists closely since 2016. In the new survey, public confidence in scientists is about the same as last year: 77% of U.S. adults say they have at
society.tldr: Decreases in public trust can hinder scientific progress and decision-making

society.headline: Manchesterism could revive Britain’s fading grandeur
society.teaser: The towns and cities of the north and the Midlands were key to Britain's global success
society.tldr: Revives Britain's global influence by rediscovering its northern and midland heritage

society.headline: Darren Jones’ vision for Whitehall
society.teaser: The chief secretary to the Prime Minister has pledged to "move fast and fix things"
society.tldr: Overturns traditional Whitehall thinking with swift action

society.headline: UK approves plans for Chinese “mega-embassy”
society.teaser: The controversial call comes ahead of an expected visit by Keir Starmer to China next week
society.tldr: Rejects UK's diplomatic balance with China's increased embassy presence

society.headline: A History of Fakery on Film
society.teaser: Concerns about AI-made images have deep roots in the earliest years of filmmaking. The post A History of Fakery on Film appeared first on JSTOR Daily .
society.tldr: Challenges fake images from film's inception reveal ongoing human deception

society.headline: The Military Is Being Forced to Plan for an Unthinkable Betrayal
society.teaser: Attacking an ally would be a perversion of everything the armed forces have been trained to do.
society.tldr: Upsets traditional notions of loyalty and honor within military institutions

society.headline: Disavowing Politics While Doing Politics
society.teaser: People often claim to be “nonpolitical” even as they seek policy change, a stance that supports civic action but narrows democratic debate. The post Disavowing Politics While Doing Politics appeared first on JSTOR Daily .
society.tldr: Undermines democratic debate by claiming neutrality while seeking policy change
